context: The Estonian verb 'kuulata' means 'to listen' in English. It is an infinitive form (dictionary form) of the verb and follows regular conjugation patterns. In present tense, it becomes 'kuulan' for first person singular ('I listen'), 'kuuled' for second person singular ('you listen'), and so on. The verb indicates the action of paying attention to what one hears or perceives audibly.
